title: Lynn man charged in kidnapping, murder of older sister
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Smith, 30, from Lynn, charged with murder and kidnapping of his sister, Michelle Knox, 38.
Smith pleaded not guilty in Lynn District Court; case records are impounded and unavailable to the public.
Smith has a history of legal issues, including a guilty plea to assault with a dangerous weapon in July.

title: Patriots captain believes defense showed ‘glimpse of dominance’ vs. Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Harold Landry praised the defense's performance against the Raiders, highlighting a 'glimpse of dominance' despite the 20-13 loss.
Landry achieved 2.5 sacks, four QB hits, and three tackles for a loss, emphasizing the unit's potential for improvement.
Patriots' offseason investments, including DT Milton Williams, showed promise, yet the defense allowed 362 passing yards to Raiders.

title: David Andrews believes this was most disappointing part of Patriots’ season-opening loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Andrews was disappointed with the Patriots' run game performance in their 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
New England generated only 60 rushing yards on 18 attempts, leading to a reliance on their passing game.
Coach Mike Vrabel acknowledged the need for more efficient running to improve overall offensive play.

title: Marco Sturm maps out the standard he’s setting for Bruins’ training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marco Sturm will lead his first training camp as Bruins head coach starting September 17 at Warrior Ice Arena.
Sturm emphasizes intensity, accountability, and a new practice standard for Bruins after last season's 33-39-10 record.
Sturm aims to improve defense and power play, seeking a bounce-back season with players like Jeremy Swayman and Charlie McAvoy.

title: Worcester girl testifies against man accused of kidnapping her, throwing her off bridge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Hubert is on trial for allegedly kidnapping, raping, and attempting to murder a 7-year-old girl in 2017.
The victim, now 15, testified about the incident where she was thrown off a bridge into Lake Quinsigamond.
Hubert pleaded not guilty, and his trial, delayed since 2020, started with opening statements on Monday.

title: Drake Maye doesn’t think he has ‘too much on his plate’ and more from WEEI interview
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye defends his workload, stating NFL quarterbacks naturally have heavy responsibilities, after a rocky game against the Raiders.
Maye acknowledges his interception in the third quarter as a key moment, stressing the need to improve execution under pressure.
Maye comments on Bill Belichick's decision to ban Patriots scouts from UNC practices, attributing it to Belichick's program management.

title: ‘Game 1 is always the hardest’: Patriots veteran shares perspective on Will Campbell’s debut
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots right tackle Morgan Moses comments on rookie Will Campbell's challenging debut against tough opponents in the NFL.
The Patriots' offensive line, featuring rookies Campbell and Wilson, allowed four sacks including two involving Campbell.
Patriots' struggled offensively, scoring only 13 points, compared to last season's average of 17 points per game.

title: Kayshon Boutte reflects on his forgotten history as an elite prospect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Kayshon Boutte was once compared to Stefon Diggs before being picked in the sixth round by the Patriots.
Boutte was a top wide receiver prospect in high school but injuries affected his college performance at LSU.
Boutte's strong preseason and breakout performance in the Patriots' opener highlight his resurgence in the NFL.

title: Hasbro is relocating its headquarters to Boston’s Seaport
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Hasbro is moving its headquarters from Pawtucket, Rhode Island to Boston's Seaport, occupying 265,000 square feet.
The new Boston headquarters will house approximately 700 full-time employees by the end of 2026.
Hasbro joins other major companies expanding in Massachusetts, including Keurig Dr Pepper and LEGO.

title: Wu heads into preliminary election with massive 50-point lead over Kraft
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu leads Josh Kraft by 50 points in an Emerson College poll ahead of Boston's preliminary election.
Wu's support among likely voters is 72%, with Kraft at 22%, showing an increase from a 30-point lead in July.
Two other candidates, Domingos DaRosa and Robert Cappucci, are also on the ballot but poll below single digits.
